The DCT Philosophy and the Logogram
DCT LOGORAM

The school logo, by itself, attests to the identity of the Dominican College of Tarlac – the character it manifests in the socio-cultural and psycho-spiritual awareness of the people invariably connected with it.The logo embodies this institution's unwavering commitment to the holistic formation of the person as well as the person's manifestation of a true educated man in the Dominican way
FUN FACT: The logo emphasizes three virtues:
The DCT Goals and Objectives
• Cognitive – to possess knowledge and skills for social communication.
• Affective – to demonstrate sensitive awareness of one's role in social building.
• Psychomotor – to positively engage oneself in relevant social issues.
SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
• Cognitive – to inculcate awareness of Filipino Christian values.
• Affective – to show appreciation of our Christian dignity as stewards of God's creation.
• Psychomotor – to promote moral commitment to ecological balance.
CHRISTIAN WITNESSING
• Cognitive – to acquire understanding of scripture teachings.
• Affective – to manifest love for the scripture.
• Psychomotor – to practice scriptural truths in every aspect of life.

Bachelor of Elementary Education
Bachelor of Elementary Education program was introduced.
TESDA Accreditation
DCT was given accreditation by TESDA during 2005–2006.
Bachelor of Science in Information Technology
2009 marked the introduction of the Bachelor of Science in Information Technology program.
Bachelor of Science in Business and Accountancy
The Bachelor of Science in Business Administration program became available in 2011.
Bachelor of Science in Criminology
In 2015, the institution expanded its academic programs with the addition of the Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice Education.
